CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper September 1, 1945, pg. 18, reads: "3238th Guard Company - Ending a fun-packed thirty-day furlough, members of the 3238th Guard Company, sponsored a dance at the North Side Elks' Hall last Friday. All of the soldiers of the company are ETO veterans, and have served in three major battles in France, Holland and Germany. They will leave Saturday for further training at Fort Warren, Yyoming [Wyoming], before they are shipped to the Pacific. Members of the company are, seated, left to right: Corp. Frank Jackson, Pfc. Bennie Martin, Sgt. James H. Plummer, Pfc. Joe Sheard and Pfc. Joe Cook. Standing, left to right: Corp. Paul Hughes, Pfc. Henry Perkins, Pfc. Charles Anderson, Corp. Paul H. Alford, Corp. Lindsay Mayfield and Corp. George Mercer. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Members of 3238th Guard Company, squatting from left: Corp. Frank Jackson, Pfc. Bennie Martin, Sgt. James H. Plummer, Pfc. Joe Sheard, Pfc. Joe Cook; standing: Corp. Paul Hughes, Pfc. Henry Perkins, Pfc. Charles Anderson, Corp. Paul H. Alford, Corp. Lindsay Mayfield and Corp. George Mercer posed in Northside Elks Hall for dance
